author: Richard Nock
title: Inducing Interpretable Voting Classifiers without Trading Accuracy for Simplicity: Theoretical Results, Approximation Algorithms, and Experiments

A quantitative comparison of l DC against the number of nodes of the DTs shows that on 4 datasets out of the 13 (Pole, Shuttle TicTacToe, Australian), the DCs are more than 6 times smaller, while they only incur a loss in accuracy for 2 of them, and limited to 1.8%.
